title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. Insufficient sanitizing of data when performing a restore could result in a cross-site scripting (XSS) risk from malicious backup files.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43437
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304266
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461207
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-81394
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4hjf-6pxr-549h
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. Insufficient capability checks make it possible for users with access to restore glossaries in courses to restore them into the global site glossary.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43435
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304263
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461205
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-64984
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4gq2-x5w4-7hp8
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle has insufficient capability checks

items.content_html:

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle has insufficient capability checks

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. Matrix room membership and power levels are incorrectly applied and revoked for suspended Moodle users.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43433
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304261
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461202
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-81951
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q99x-mjmh-v8w7
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle's user/power level management inconsistent with suspended users

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. Matrix room membership and power levels are incorrectly applied and revoked for suspended Moodle users.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43433
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304261
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461202
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-81951
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q99x-mjmh-v8w7
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle's user/power level management inconsistent with suspended users

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. The cURL wrapper in Moodle strips HTTPAUTH and USERPWD headers during emulated redirects, but retains other original request headers, so HTTP authorization header information could be unintentionally sent in requests to redirect URLs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43432
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304260
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461200
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-82136
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7wmp-2xmx-g6h8
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle authorization headers preserved between "emulated redirects"

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. The cURL wrapper in Moodle strips HTTPAUTH and USERPWD headers during emulated redirects, but retains other original request headers, so HTTP authorization header information could be unintentionally sent in requests to redirect URLs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43432
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304260
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461200
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-82136
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7wmp-2xmx-g6h8
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle authorization headers preserved between "emulated redirects"

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. The cURL wrapper in Moodle strips HTTPAUTH and USERPWD headers during emulated redirects, but retains other original request headers, so HTTP authorization header information could be unintentionally sent in requests to redirect URLs.

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle authorization headers preserved between "emulated redirects"

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. The cURL wrapper in Moodle strips HTTPAUTH and USERPWD headers during emulated redirects, but retains other original request headers, so HTTP authorization header information could be unintentionally sent in requests to redirect URLs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43432

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle authorization headers preserved between "emulated redirects"

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. External API access to Quiz can override contained insufficient access control.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43430
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304258
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461198
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-82633
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jpf2-9ppp-2c49
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle has insufficient access control

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. Some hidden user profile fields are visible in gradebook reports, which could result in users without the "view hidden user fields" capability having access to the information.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43429
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304257
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461197
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-79541
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c767-4whh-v7rw
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle has user information visibility control issues in gradebook reports

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. Some hidden user profile fields are visible in gradebook reports, which could result in users without the "view hidden user fields" capability having access to the information.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43429

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle. When creating an export of site administration presets, some sensitive secrets and keys are not being excluded from the export, which could result in them unintentionally being leaked if the presets are shared with a third party.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43427
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304255
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461195
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-79373
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vpq5-56jj-vf2m
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle admin presets export tool includes some secrets that should not be exported
